title: STUDY WITH DISABILITIES
quote: Everybody is a genius. But if you judge a fish by its ability to climb a tree, it will live its whole life believing that it is stupid.
paragraph1: Over the last two decades, the Cameroonian State has adopted an arsenal of legal texts to facilitate and guarantee access to higher education for students with disabilities.
paragraph2: Although much remains to be done, particularly in terms of accessibility to buildings, availability of specialized teachers, development of appropriate teaching and learning materials (books in Braille or sign language, etc.), processing of requests for exemptions and other waivers, extension of exemptions from university fees to PHEIs, etc., the following major advances should be noted, which have contributed to an increase in the number of students with disabilities in Cameroonian state universities over the years.
handicapTitle: Legal Measures towards students with disabilities

content.normalText: A student's disability should not be a reason for rejection for admission to a higher education institution or ordinary training centers;
Obligation of public institutions to comply in order to accommodate students with disabilities: integration of the disability approach in the construction of buildings, public buildings, etc.
Effective implementation of full or partial exemption from university fees in state universities;
Taking into account the disability approach in the awarding of scholarships for academic excellence;
Granting of subsidies for the purchase of didactic equipment appropriate to special educational needs;
Prioritizing disabled people in the allocation of student accommodation;
Age dispense in administrative competitions for recruitment to public jobs; For equal qualifications, priority must be given to the disabled person.

exemptionInfo.bold: To benefit from exemption from university fees,
